CatDescriptText: Mrs. Rhoda Smith, housewife and mother, of 35 Heldman Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 21, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that taxpayers would oppose a raise in taxes to build new schools and to repair old ones which may be or might soon become fire traps?" answer reads: "No, I don't see why they would oppose such a raise, because this would be for the safety of their children. For peace of mind alone, they should, and I think they would not oppose an increase in taxes."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Rhoda Smith, wearing dark leather coat and light colored shirt, holding rectangular package, standing on sidewalk with pedestrians and grocery store in background
